title: Instant Pot® Loaded Baked Potato Soup

Ingredients.2: 4 thick slices cherrywood-smoked bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces

Ingredients.4: 1.0 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and chopped

Ingredients.6: 0.5 teaspoons garlic base (such as Better Than Bouillon® Roasted Garlic Base)

Directions.1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function. Add onion, bacon, and butter to the hot pot and saute until bacon is crispy, 5 to 8 minutes. Turn off Saute function and transfer contents to a small bowl.

Directions.2: Add potatoes, water, and garlic base to pot and close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 12 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Directions.3: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 15 minutes. Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Mash potatoes against the side of the pot, leaving some chunks if desired. Add onion-bacon mixture and half-and-half; stir to combine.

Directions.4: Ladle into soup bowls and top with green onions, Cheddar cheese, and black pepper.
